instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_FAN_0_CTL: What is SMC_FAN_0_CTL? SMC_FAN_0_CTL is a line between the SMC and the fan that controls fan speed that is frequently disturbed when someone inexperienced knocks resistors in the area off with their fingernail or screwdriver when unplugging the fan. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan control fault
threads.message:
Liquid damaged board, all other faults fixed but this one with the fan.
ASD reports unable to stabilize between min/max speed.
Fan is not speeding up on fan test.

Replaced fan twice.

3V3 getting through <RESISTOR>R6010</RESISTOR> = 0Ohms
Fan tach <RESISTOR>R6065</RESISTOR> = 47k
<RESISTOR>R6061</RESISTOR> = 100k
<RESISTOR>R6060</RESISTOR> = 47k

Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> to be sure.

Is <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL> a PWM control?
What to look for now?

Cheers

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan control fault
threads.message: That pretty much only leaves the SMC. Diode mode on <SIGNAL>FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan control fault
threads.message:
0.473V diode mode on <SIGNAL>FAN_0_CTL</SIGNAL>
I'll just bung on a new SMC on and see what happens

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan control fault
